newsitem.title: UK: UK grains close higher as shorts seek cover.
newsitem.headline: UK grains close higher as shorts seek cover.

text.p: UK grain futures now trading under the new LIFFE banner after the merger of the LIFFE and LCE which took effect on Monday morning closed higher on shortcovering and spill-over sentiment.
"There are still a few shorts about, but mainly it appears to be sentiment on the back of the Franch sale of 450,000 tonnes of wheat to Egypt," said a trader.
"Really it's got nothing to do with our market but the resulting higher prices in France have give the UK market room to move up again," the traded added.
Others said sellers had also withdrawn on a rising market. "They seem to be waiting to see how high it will go before they come back in," said one.
Wheat futures closed 1.20 to 0.90 stg up after trading 476 lots while barley was 1.75 to 0.05 stg higher on 129 lots.
In Amsterdam the milling wheat futures contract was neglected.
Higher futures brought cash trading almost to a halt with fob prices 0.50 stg up in a tradeless market.
Delivered market traders reported only light trading mainly for Oct/Dec material.
